CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C03

TI_TEXT.P: Servicii de învăţământ şi formare profesională

TITLE.P: 16 188 Provider Panel for the Provision of Apprenticeship Training for Cheshire East Council and Stockport Council

SHORT_DESCR.P: Cheshire East Council & Stockport Metropolitan Borough Council issued an ITT for the provision of a panel of providers of Apprenticeships. The Consortium aims to recruit new staff and upskill existing staff through an apprenticeship programme, seeking to maximise the Apprenticeship Levy for the councils, (ASDVs) and maintained schools within the areas covered as below:
— Legal, Accounting, Finance & Insurance Services,
— Agriculture, Environmental & Animal Care,
— Business, Customer Service, Leadership & Management,
— Childcare & Education, Health & Social Care,
— Construction, Engineering & Manufacturing,
— Hospitality & Catering,
— Sales, Marketing & Procurement,
— Degree and Masters Apprenticeships,
— Miscellaneous,
— ICT.
The consortium cannot guarantee volumes/values. The maximum annual levy is:
Cheshire East: GBP 740 000.
Stockport: GBP 900 000.
The consortium intends to reopen this opportunity to join the Provider Panel at least 3 times a year.

TITLE.P: Lot 1 Legal, Accounting, Finance and Insurance Services

SHORT_DESCR.P: Legal, Accounting, Finance and Insurance Services Apprenticeships. The consortium cannot guarantee volumes/values. The projected annual spend for this lot is:
Cheshire East: GBP 101,250k.
Stockport: GBP 10,250k.

Whilst anticipated spend on this lot has been included in the field below and text above as an indication of spend, this will depend on business need and may be significantly more or less throughout the duration of the framework.
Further details can be found here: http://www.cheshireeast.gov.uk/jobs_and_careers/apprenticeships_a-team/providing-apprenticeship-training.aspx

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: This contract is for 3 years, commencing 1.1.2018 with the option to extend for a further 12 months. Subsequent contracts will be awarded following reopening competition every 3 months.
Further details can be found here: http://www.cheshireeast.gov.uk/jobs_and_careers/apprenticeships_a-team/providing-apprenticeship-training.aspx

INFO_ADD.P: The Consortium intends to reopen this opportunity to join the Provider Panel at least 3 times a year. New competitions will usually be after new providers have been appointed to the Government’s RoATP so that providers who did not previously meet the criteria have the opportunity to join.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: In accordance with Regulation 86 (Notices of decisions to award a contract), Regulation 87 (Standstill Period) and Regulation 91 (Enforcement of duties through the court) of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (as amended).

Cheshire East Borough Council will incorporate a standstill period at the point information on the award of the contract is communicated to tenderers. That notification will provide full information on the award decision. The standstill period, which will be for a minimum of 10 calendar days provides time for unsuccessful tenderers to review and scrutinize the award decision before the contract is entered into.
There is an ongoing chest advert detailing information on re-opening dates along with a list of providers for each lot.
